data.title: JACK PARNELL AND HIS MUSIC
data.meta_description: motion picture |   Made-for-TV series.   Short film (under 30 minutes).   1. "Caravan" by Irving Mills, Juan Tizol, Duke Ellington; "It never entered my mind" by Richard Rodgers, Richard Rodgers (RC); "Happy feet" by Jack Yellen, Milton Ager (RC, JP); "I loves you, Porgy" by Du Bose Heyward, Ira and George Gershwin (DL); "Begin the beguine" by Cole Porter; "I'm a woman" by Mike Stoller, Jerry Leiber (MB); "Dance, dance, dance" by Brian Wilson, Carl Wilson (MB, RC).  2. "Hot toddy" by Herb Hendler, Ralph Flanagan; "Genevieve" theme by Larry Adler (LA). 3. "Fire and rain" by James Taylor (AJ); "So long girl" (AJ); "Aguas de Marco" by Antonio Carlos Jobim (MB). 4. "Serenade in blue"; "At last", "People like you and me", "Chattanooga choo choo" by Mack Gordon, Harry Warren; "The anvil chorus" by Giuseppe Verdi; "St. Louis blues march" by W. C. Handy. 6. "Limehouse blues" by Douglas Furber, Philip Braham (GC); "These foolish things" by Eric Maschwitz, Jack Strachey, Harry Link (BS). (Songs).   Jack Parnell and his Orchestra featuring:- Episode 1. Roy Castle; Don Lusher, trombone; Madeleine Bell, vocal. Episode 2. Larry Adler, harmonica; Marian Montgomery, vocal. Episode 3. Al Jarreau, Madeleine Bell, vocal. Episode 4. "A tribute to Glenn Miller". Episode 5. Tony Lee, piano. Episode 6. George Chisholm, trombone; Betty Smith, tenor sax. (Personnel On Camera).   Motion Picture (Form).
